intro: Cyclophorus dimorphus, commonly known as the two-form cyclophorus, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation and biodiversity.
